data.title: Use height offset when rendering voxels.

This is one of N immediate prereqs for fixing #4823.

data.title: Some D2k clean-ups
data.body: Adresses most remaining issues from  #7274.

data.title: Recompressed a number of shp(td) files with shapeset
data.body:
There were still a number of shps with far from optimal compression. I recompressed all larger shps that showed signifcant gains (either in terms of percentage, absolute gains or both) with Blade's shapeset command line tool, which applies optimal compression to each frame.

I intentionally didn't check most files smaller than 4KB (too much hassle for low absolute gains), and also intentionally didn't update files where the gains were negligible, to keep the number of updated files in check.

This shrinks the installed size of OpenRA by ~700-800KB and the installer by ~1/10th of that.

data.body:
At the moment the whole game will just freeze. Also needs to make sure that bots get handed over. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Server/Server.cs#L585

data.title: Idea : Sketching tools for map creation
data.body:
I'm thinking mostly of drawing lines, with different colors. 
(Could be further developed : points, squares, circles, dashed / solid lines, etc ...)

Could be used to sketch the big lines of a map (cliffs, rivers, ...)
(With the further developed tools above : decoration (trees, buildings, ...) , zones of interest, ore patches, etc ...)

Sketching could be done on a separate layer, that you can show / hide with toggle button.

data.title: Disable slot admin dropdown when empty.
data.body:
Fixes #7226.

Testcase: Start a skirmish in RA, select Poland Raid map, then become a spectator.

data.title: Cancel PBOG on death
data.body:
Fixes #7791.

Testcase: Build a structure, issue a commando/tanya order to demolish one of the prerequisites to the structure (does not need to be the construction yard), and then activate the building placement mode before the demolition activates.

data.title: Cancel custom input modes when opening the menu.
data.body:
Fixes #3277.

Testcase: Enter the building placement mode and then press escape to open the menu.

data.title: Cancel tooltips when opening the ingame menu.
data.body:
Fixes #6936.

Testcase: hover the cursor over an actor until the tooltip shows, then press escape to open the menu.

data.title: Disable color validation for locked colors.
data.body:
Fixes #7899.

Testcase: set `Visibility: Lobby` on "Storm the Beachhead" or another GDI campaign mission and select it in the skirmish lobby.

data.title: Difficulty to see enemy with GPS Satellite under FoW, if enemy's color is close to terrain's
data.body:
When some players choose colors close to terrain's (on temperal maps, dark green, dark blue, ... or even manage to get black with some color trick), it is very hard to see their GPS symbols under the FoW. 

So it can become much easier to sneak attack, which is almost impossible for players who use colors with contrast to terrain.

Not sure what the solution could be. 
- Maybe an equivalent of #9801, but changing the whole color of the enemy team (GPS symbols + maybe units themselves). Not happy with this solution though.
- And further limiting colors might not be an option (#10217)
- Or maybe a white outline on the symbols ? Not liking this too ...

data.title: Make WithParachute respect player remap colors.
data.body:
Currently it does not remap as expected.
[It only has a palette property, not a matching player flag](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/8a755e673c20ede44cab5d82e2a1b21e9b98fa97/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Render/WithParachute.cs#L34-L35).

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/12301729/e1e0cb04-ba21-11e5-9a01-b34efab82a72.png)

data.title: Added an option to replace disconnected players with AI bots
data.body: A simplified version of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8059. Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3001. Depends on https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10787.

data.title: Same start positions and option to start game with all conyards/robes
data.body:
Ability to select the same starting position for different players will give players more freedom of choice in a team game.

Like StarCraft, let the first player chose the first starting pozschitsiyu appears precisely at this point, and the player who chose the first position after the first player, let him appear in close proximity to this position.
## http://i081.radikal.ru/1601/df/3c806a763023.png

Start game with all conyards/robes awalebel in mod (may be ALL SIDES in side select BOX?)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iDWZ2Y0rgG4
In start the game player have GDI and NOD conyards in td/ts mods
in ra/ra2 mod, player have Soviet and Allied conyards
## in d2k mod he have all three conyards (Harkonnen, Ordos, Artreiders) 

I think it'll be intresting things

PS. sorri for my bad Inglish.

data.title: Teams at the Minimap
data.body:
I suggest do additionally draw the team number of the players on the minimap.
In my opinion this would speed up the match making and avoid games with twisted teams.

The picture is just a mock-up. and shall help to show what I mean. 
Feel free to feedback. ( Only Spot orange D and green A has the new visualization)

![minimap idea](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5147014/12274572/bcd4558a-b96b-11e5-8064-7aebc43d6d65.png)

data.title: Statistics : Army size (number of units)
data.body:
Currently, I think that currently only the "Assets" information can compare the size of the armies (all mixed)

It would be interesting to know what number of units each player has.

Maybe this could be : 
- further detailed into types of units ? (infantry, vehicles, air, naval + maybe buildings ?) 
- a new 6th tab in the statistics (after "Basics", ...)

data.title: AI won't deploy Conyard if the actor is a helicopter.
data.body: A reminder asked by pchote, please let me know if an example code is needed or anyhing.

data.title: Idea : A "keep formation" movement
data.body:
When a group of units move from A to B, they arrive at B with the same arrangement as they were at A.

This would be useful in cases like : 
- setting a "+" formation of 5 units (point A), sent them to the target (point B) and arriving there with the same "+" formation, then Iron Curtained there.
- keeping long range units behind tank units

They don't need to keep the formation along the path, but only at point B.
